3.text:
The harder you work the more money you make.
You've got three types of rickshaw riders:

8.text:
the fisherman, the explorer and the hunter.
The fisherman will try to sit in places like

15.text:
Leicester Square, Covent Garden tube station,
Soho. The explorer will just pretty much go

20.text:
anywhere that they happen to take a ride to,
then you have the hunter, who's very specific,

28.text:
he'll stay pretty much around Old Compton
Street, Shaftesbury Avenue and he's looking

33.text:
for a specific type of customer who is looking
for unusual forms of entertainment and they're

40.text:
willing to pay anything for it. I'm basically
a explorer. I've been in the rickshaw industry

51.text:
for 16 years, I would never have guessed that
I would be here this long. I got here from

57.text:
the bottom up, first I was rickshaw rider,
then I learned how to do the mechanics on

62.text:
the bikes and the designing and then I took
over The Base. Our Base is controlled chaos

71.text:
for unusual characters. Rickshaws get brought
here, dropped off and parked for the night

77.text:
and they get repaired. We also have company
owners wait here to collect rent and storage

85.text:
of all sorts of things including people's
push bikes. The rickshaw industry is a mixture

90.text:
between beggars and ghosts for some people,
you sometimes certainly have that feeling

96.text:
when you're riding. It's very unusual for
anyone to talk to a rickshaw rider unless

99.text:
they want a lift. The kind of people that
normally are drawn to it are those who are

104.text:
quite open minded and sometimes those who
have very little choice, so that's most of

109.text:
the time somebody like myself who's from another
country who would come here and may not have

115.text:
the same opportunities because of either language
or the kind of educational history that they

121.text:
can show. If you need a 9-5 job this isn't
it. There are some dark sides you can come

130.text:
across people who will start abusing you.
They have issues so they'll start shouting

138.text:
at you or hitting you whilst you're riding
or take a very long lift with a guy in a suit

143.text:
and the guy is like 'oh I haven't got my wallet
on me' and he goes into the hotel and he disappears.

148.text:
It can eat you up and destroy your night so
normally you wash off those moments and just

154.text:
get on with life. You need to have a sense
of humour and that's the best skill of a rickshaw

160.text:
rider. My first thought of rickshawing was
this is fucking brilliant. I just couldn't

167.text:
believe how crazy it was. You realise that
you're actually connected to the city in more

173.text: than just you're here to earn a living.
